meanings.definition: Of or relating to a calyx.
meanings.sent1: The calycular petals protected the delicate flower bud.
meanings.sent2: The botanist admired the calycular structure of the plant.
meanings.sent3: The calycular shape of the vase made it look like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent4: Her calycular embrace provided comfort and protection.
meanings.sent5: The calycular design of the garden gate was intricate and beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The calycular plant displayed vibrant colors in its calyx.
meanings.sent2: The florist carefully examined the calycular arrangement for the event.
meanings.sent3: The calycular bouquet stood out among the other floral decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her calycular necklace was a unique accessory for the party.
meanings.sent5: The calycular patterns on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the dress.

meanings.sent1: The calycular shape of the seashell reminded her of a flower bud.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the calycular essence in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The calycular clouds in the sky looked like giant flower petals.
meanings.sent4: His calycular artwork was praised for its creativity.
meanings.sent5: The calycular design of the building entrance was inspired by nature.
